question.questiontext: I. The earth is not spherical but elliptical in shape. II. Variation in latitude and longitude. III. Rotation of the earth on its axis. IV. Variation in the density of the earth. On which combination of the above does the weight of an object vary on the earth’s surface?
If a spherical metal bob of radius 3cm is fully immersed in a cylinder containing water and the water level rises by 1cm, what is the radius of the cylinder?
The efficiency of a machine is always less than 100% because the
question.optiona: velocity ratio is always greater than the mechanical advantage.
question.optionb: work output is always greater than the work input.
question.optionc: effort applied is always greater than the load lifted.
question.optiond: load lifted is always greater than the effort applied.

The magnetic force on a charged particle moving with velocity v is
question.optiona: independent of the magnitude of the charge.
question.optionb: proportional to both the magnitude of the charge and the velocity v.
